meanings.definition: A piece of furniture or other item that is sold in pieces and must be assembled by the buyer.
meanings.sent1: I bought some flatpacks for my new apartment and spent the weekend assembling them.
meanings.sent2: The store sells flatpacks of bookshelves and tables that you can put together at home.
meanings.sent3: When I opened the flatpacks, I realized I had forgotten to read the instructions!
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like a series of flatpacks, each piece needing to be put together carefully.
meanings.sent5: The flatpacks were like a puzzle waiting to be solved, with each piece fitting perfectly into place.

meanings.definition: To assemble furniture or other items that are sold in pieces.
meanings.sent1: I need to flatpacks the new desk I bought from the store.
meanings.sent2: She flatpacks all her furniture because she enjoys the process of putting things together.
meanings.sent3: As he flatpacks the chair, he realizes he has an extra screw left over.
meanings.sent4: The team flatpacks the shelves quickly, working together to finish the task.
meanings.sent5: Flatpacking the wardrobe was a satisfying challenge, seeing it come together piece by piece.
